attributes.action: make representations to Dudley Metropolitan Council to urge them to reconsider their decision to close Broadfield House Glass Museum.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Situated in the historic Stourbridge Glass Quarter, Broadfield House Glass Museum has a magnificent collection of British glass, much of it made locally, dating from the 17th century up to the present day. 

Council chiefs revealed last week (mid Jan 09) they are considering closing Broadfield House as part of plans to shave £120,000 off next year’s museums bill. A proposed move to the Redhouse cone should not be considered as the premises are only on lease from Waterfood Wedgewood, and the size of the collection at Broadfield House would appear to more than exceed the capacity at the Redhouse Cone.

Broadfield House is the only dedicated glass museum in the UK of international repute and ranked in the top five nationwide.
